p: Basil ( Ocimum basilicum) is one of the most widely used aromatic plants. Due to its chemical composition, it is used in perfumery, cooking, food industry, toothpaste, in the production of cosmetics and medicine [ 1]. Currently, the essential oil of O. basilicum has been studied as an alternative in the control of stored grain pests [ 2]. The essential oil of O. basilicum exhibit a wide variety of chemical compounds, depending on the variations of the chemotypes, leaf, flowers and plant origin [ 3]. Its main components include estragole, linalool and eugenol [ 4].
